channel.title: math.KT updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.KT updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Symmetric versus genuine symmetric forms in Hermitian K-theory
item.description: arXiv:2503.14288v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We show that for regular Noetherian rings that contain a field or are smooth over a Dedekind domain, the canonical map from the Hermitian K-theory of genuine symmetric forms to that of symmetric forms is an equivalence in degrees greater or equal -1 and a monomorphism in degree -2. In particular, the spaces of Hermitian K-theory of genuine symmetric forms and the symplectic K-theory space are homotopy invariant for such rings.
item.dc:creator: Marco Schlichting

item.title: Hochschild cohomology and extensions of triangulated categories
item.description: arXiv:2503.13700v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We define a notion of categorical first order deformations for (enhanced) triangulated categories. For a category $\mathcal{T}$, we show that there is a bijection between $\operatorname{HH}^2(\mathcal{T})$ and the set of categorical deformations of $\mathcal{T}$. We show that in the case of curved deformations of dg algebras considered in arXiv:2406.04945, the $1$-derived category of the deformation (introduced in arXiv:24020.8660) is a categorical deformation of the derived category of the base; the Hochschild class identified by this deformation is shown to restrict to the class defining the deformation of the algebra. As an application, we give a conceptual proof of the fact that (for a smooth base) the filtered derived category of a dg deformation yields a categorical resolution of the classical derived category.
item.dc:creator: Alessandro Lehmann, Wendy Lowen

item.title: The passage from the integral to the rational group ring in algebraic $K$-theory
item.description: arXiv:2110.01413v4 Announce Type: replace Abstract: An open question is whether the map $\widetilde{K_0 }\mathbb{Z} G \rightarrow \widetilde{K_0 }\mathbb{Q} G$ in reduced $K$-theory from the integral to the rational group ring is trivial for any group $G$. We will show that this is false, with a counterexample given by the group $QD_{32} *_{Q_{16}} QD_{32}$. We will also show how to compute the image of the map $\widetilde{K_0 }\mathbb{Z} G \rightarrow \widetilde{K_0 }\mathbb{Q} G$ using representation theoretic means, assuming $G$ satisfies the Farrell-Jones conjecture.
item.dc:creator: Georg Lehner

item.title: The third homology of projective special linear group of degree two
item.description: arXiv:2401.04341v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: In this paper we investigate the third homology of the projective special linear group ${\rm PSL}_2(A)$. As a result of our investigation we prove a projective refined Bloch-Wigner exact sequence over certain class of rings. The projective Bloch-Wigner exact sequence over an algebraically closed field of characteristic zero is a classical result and has many application in algebra, number theory and geometry.
item.dc:creator: Behrooz Mirzaii, Elvis Torres P\'erez

item.title: Tensor category equivariant KK-theory
item.description: arXiv:2305.07255v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: In this paper, we introduce Kasparov's bivariant K-theory that is equivariant under symmetries of a C*-tensor category. It is motivated by some dualities in quantum group equivariant KK-theory, and the classification theory of inclusions of C*-algebras. The fundamental properties of the KK-theory, i.e., the existence of the Kasparov product, Cuntz's picture, universality, and triangulated category structure, hold true in this generalization as well. Moreover, we further prove a new property specific to this theory; the invariance of KK-theory under weak Morita equivalence of the tensor categories. As an example, we study the Baum-Connes type property for $3$-cocycle twists of discrete groups.
item.dc:creator: Yuki Arano, Kan Kitamura, Yosuke Kubota

item.title: Construction of logarithmic cohomology theories I
item.description: arXiv:2503.01043v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We propose a method for constructing cohomology theories of logarithmic schemes with strict normal crossing boundaries by employing techniques from logarithmic motivic homotopy theory over $\mathbb{F}_1$. This method recovers the K-theory of the open complement of a strict normal crossing divisor from the K-theory of schemes as well as logarithmic topological Hochschild homology from the topological Hochschild homology of schemes. In our applications, we establish that the K-theory of non-regular schemes is representable in the logarithmic motivic homotopy category, and we introduce the logarithmic cyclotomic trace for the regular log regular case.
item.dc:creator: Doosung Park
